armenian_translit: yes lsel yem, vor nra kiny vt’ari e yent’arkvel
english: I heard that your wife had an accident.

armenian_translit: yes lsel yem, vor na hivandanots’um e
english: I heard that she is in the hospital.

armenian_translit: yes lsel yem, vor k’vo mek’yenan liovin p’ch’ats’yel e
english: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.

armenian_translit: yes urakh yem, vor duk’ yekel yek’
yes urakh yem, vor duk’ hetak’rk’rut’yun unek’
english: I’m happy that you are interested.

armenian_translit: yes urakh yem, vor duk’ ayd tuny gnel yek’ ts’ankanum
english: I’m happy that you want to buy the house.

armenian_translit: yes mtavakhut’yun unem, vor verjin avtobusy arden meknel e
english: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.

armenian_translit: yes mtavakhut’yun unem, vor menk’ tak’si petk’ e verts’nenk’
english: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.

armenian_translit: yes mtavakhut’yun unem, vor im mot voch’ mi p’vogh ch’ka
english: I’m afraid I have no more money.

armenian_translit: yes ch’gitem, t’ye na indz sirum e
english: I don’t know if he loves me.
I don’t know if he’ll come back.

armenian_translit: yes ch’gitem, t’ye na indz kzangahari
english: I don’t know if he’ll call me.

armenian_translit: yes ink’s indz harts’num yem, t’ye na im masin mtatsum e
english: I wonder if he thinks about me.

armenian_translit: yes ink’s indz harts’num yem, t’ye na mek urishin uni
english: I wonder if he has someone else.

armenian_translit: yes ink’s indz harts’num yem, t’ye na stum e
t’ye na im masin mtatsu՞m e
t’ye na na mek urishin uni՞

english: Maybe he tells me the truth?

armenian_translit: yes kaskatsum yem, t’ye na indz iskapes hamakrum e
english: I doubt whether he really likes me.

armenian_translit: yes kaskatsum yem, t’ye na e indz grum
english: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.

armenian_translit: yes kaskatsum yem, t’ye na e im het kamusnana
english: I doubt whether he’ll marry me.

armenian_translit: miguts’ye na indz iskapes hamakru՞m e
miguts’ye na e im het kamusnana՞
yes spasum yem, minch’yev mazers ch’voranan
english: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.

armenian_translit: yes spasum yem, minch’yev filmy avartvi
english: I’ll wait until the film is over.

armenian_translit: yes spasum yem, minch’yev lusanshany kanach’ lini
english: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
Repair the roof before the winter begins.

armenian_translit: lva dzerrk’yerd, minch’ du seghan nstes
english: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
Close the window before you go out.
Yes, after the class is over.

armenian_translit: vt’arits’ heto na aylevs ch’karoghats’av ashkhatel
english: After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.

armenian_translit: ashkhatank’y korts’neluts’ heto na meknets’ amerika
english: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
After he went to America, he became rich.

armenian_translit: inch’k’a՞n zhamanak e, vor na ch’i ashkhatum
english: Since when is she no longer working?

armenian_translit: ayo, na amusnut’yunits’ heto aywyevs ch’i ashkhatum
english: Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.

armenian_translit: amusnanaluts’ sksats na aylevs ch’i ashkhatum
english: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
Since they have met each other, they are happy.

armenian_translit: yerekhaner unenaluts’ sksats’ nrank’ hazvadep yen yerekoyan durs gn
english: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.

armenian_translit: na herrakhosov khosum e varelu ynt’ats’k’um
na herrustats’uyts’ e nayum hardukelu ynt’ats’k’um
english: She watches TV while she irons.

armenian_translit: na yerazhshtut’yun e lsum handznararut’yunnery katarelu ynt’‰
english: She listens to music while she does her work.

armenian_translit: yes voch’inch’ ch’yem tesnum, yet’ye yes aknots’ ch’unem
english: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.

armenian_translit: yes voch’inch’ ch’yem haskanum, yet’ye yerazhshtut’yuny bardzr e
english: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.

armenian_translit: yes voch’ mi hot ch’yem zgum, yet’ye harbukhov hivand yem
english: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.

armenian_translit: menk’ tak’si yenk’ verts’num, yet’ye andzrev e galis
english: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.

armenian_translit: menk’ ashkharhov kshrjagayenk’, yet’ye lotoyov gumar shahenk’
english: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.

armenian_translit: menk’ ksksenk’ chashy, yet’ye na shutov ch’ga
english: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.

armenian_translit: yes ver yem kenum, yerb zarduts’ich’y zngum e
english: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.

armenian_translit: yes hognum yem, yerb petk’ e sovorem
english: I become tired as soon as I have to study.

armenian_translit: yes kdadarem ashkhatel, yerb yes vat’sun tarekan darrnam
english: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
As soon as I have a moment.

armenian_translit: na kzangahari, yerb na zhamanak unena
english: He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
I’ll work as long as I can.

armenian_translit: yes kashkhatem, inch’k’an vor arroghj linem
english: I’ll work as long as I am healthy.

armenian_translit: na ankoghnum parrkats e ashkhatelu p’vokharen
english: He lies in bed instead of working.

armenian_translit: na t’yert’ e kardum yep’yelu p’vokharen
english: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.

armenian_translit: na pandokum nstats e tun gnalu p’vokharen
english: He is at the bar instead of going home.

armenian_translit: inch’k’an gitem na aystegh e aprum
english: As far as I know, he lives here.

armenian_translit: inch’k’an gitem nra kiny hivand e
english: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
As far as I know, he is unemployed.

armenian_translit: yes k’nats ei mnats’yel, t’ye ch’e chshtapah klinei
english: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.

armenian_translit: yes avtobusits’ ushats’a, t’ye ch’e chshtapah klinei
english: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.

armenian_translit: yes chanaparhy ch’yem gtel, t’ye ch’e chshtapah klinei
english: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.

armenian_translit: na k’nel er, ch’nayats vor herrustats’uyts’y miats’rats er
english: He fell asleep although the TV was on.

armenian_translit: na derr mnats’yel er, ch’nayats vor arden ush er
english: He stayed a while although it was late.

armenian_translit: na ch’er yekel, ch’nayats vor paymanavorvats eink’
english: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.

armenian_translit: herrustats’uyts’y miats’rats er aynuamenayniv na k’nel er
english: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.

armenian_translit: arden ush er aynuamenayniv na derr mnats’yel er
english: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.

armenian_translit: menk’ paymanavorvats eink’ aynuamenayniv na ch’er yekel
english: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.

armenian_translit: ch’nayats vor na varordakan iravunk’ ch’uni, na mek’yena e varum
english: Although he has no license, he drives the car.

armenian_translit: ch’nayats vor p’voghots’y sahun e, na arag e varum
english: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.

armenian_translit: ch’nayats vor na khmats e, na hetsaniv e k’shum
english: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.

armenian_translit: na varordakan iravunk’ ch’uni aynuamenayniv na mek’yena e varu
english: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.

armenian_translit: p’voghots’y sahun e aynuamenayniv na arag e varum
english: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.

armenian_translit: na khmats e aynuamenayniv na hetsaniv e k’shum
english: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.

armenian_translit: na ashkhatank’i tegh ch’i gtnum, ch’nayats vor bardzraguyn krt’ut’yun u
english: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.

armenian_translit: na bzhshki ch’i gnum, ch’nayats vor ts’aver uni
english: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.

armenian_translit: na mek’yena e gnum, ch’nayats vor p’vogh ch’uni
english: Although she has no money, she buys a car.

armenian_translit: na usanel e bayts’ na ashkhatank’ ch’i gtnum
english: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.

armenian_translit: na ts’aver uni aynuamenayniv na bzhshki ch’i gnum
english: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.

armenian_translit: na p’vogh ch’uni aynuamenayniv na mek’yena e gnum
english: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.

armenian_translit: chambordut’yuny t’yeev geghets’ik er, bayts’ naev hognets’uts’ich’
english: The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.

armenian_translit: gnats’k’y t’yeev chshtapah er, bayts’ naev lets’un
english: The train was on time, but too full.

armenian_translit: hyuranots’y t’yeev harmaravet er, bayts’ naev t’ank
english: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.

armenian_translit: na kam avtobusn e verts’num, kam el gnats’k’y
english: He’ll take either the bus or the train.

armenian_translit: na kam aysor yerekoyan kga, kam vaghy shut
english: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.

armenian_translit: na kam mez mot kapri, kam hyuranots’um
english: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.

armenian_translit: na t’ye ́ ispaneren e khosum t’ye ́ angleren
english: She speaks Spanish as well as English.

armenian_translit: na t’ye ́ madridum e aprel yev t’ye  ́londonum
english: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.

armenian_translit: na chanach’um e t’ye ́ ispanian yev t’ye ́anglian
english: She knows Spain as well as England.

armenian_translit: na voch’ miayn himar e, ayl naev tsuyl
english: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.

armenian_translit: na voch’ miayn geghets’ik e, ayl naev khelats’i
english: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.

armenian_translit: na khosum e voch’ miayn germaneren, ayl naev franseren
english: She speaks not only German, but also French.

armenian_translit: yes voch’ dashnamur yem nvagum, voch’ el kit’arr
english: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.

armenian_translit: yes voch’ vals yem parum, voch’ el samba
english: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.

armenian_translit: yes voch’ opera yem sirum, voch’ el balet
english: I like neither opera nor ballet.

armenian_translit: inch’k’an arag du ashkhates, aynk’an shut kverjats’nes
english: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.

armenian_translit: inch’k’an shut gas, aynk’an shut kgnas
english: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.

armenian_translit: inch’k’an tseranum yes, aynk’an harmaravet yes darrnum
english: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.

armenian_translit: i՞nch’pes karogh yem dzer tsnoghneri tun gnal
english: How do I get to her parents’ house?
The house is at the end of the road.
What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
What time is the museum open?

armenian_translit: yerbeve mi angam berrlinum yeghe՞l yek’
english: Have you already been to Berlin?

armenian_translit: inch’ vor mekin (voch’ vok’i)aystegh chanach’u՞m yek’
voch’, yes aystegh voch’ meki(voch’ vok’i) ch’yem chanach’um
english: No, I don’t know anyone here.
a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?

armenian_translit: voch’, yes aystegh aylevs ch’yem mnalu
english: No, I won’t stay here much longer.

armenian_translit: derr inch’ vor ban uzu՞m yek’ khmel
english: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.

armenian_translit: arden inch’ vor ban - derr voch’inch’
arden inch’ vor ban kere՞l yek’
voch’, derr yes voch’inch’ ch’yem kerel
english: No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.

armenian_translit: inch’ vor meky surch ts’ankanu՞m e
english: Does anyone else want a coffee?
